history.content:
Chances are many companies can hire to start right after you graduate as many companies are fairly flexible with starting date. 

I applied during fall, like many others did (perhaps later than most; I think I started the process in October). Receiving my offer in December, I was told that the earliest I could start in March because February was full (or something), so that did involve a few months before starting; presumably this would have been earlier if I had just applied earlier.

Anecdotally, I am given to understand that many students who finish in spring don't immediately have a job either, and tend to find offers after graduation.
Chances are many companies can hire to start right after you graduate as many companies are fairly flexible with starting date.

I would encourage more students to respond.

Some of the folks I know who graduated in Fall spent the Spring either looking for work, or traveling. I'm not sure if that's just a choice they made.

children.subject: Some companies I applied to had special recruitment timelines for Fall graduates. Based on what I've seen, there's plenty of jobs throughout the year. You may have to go look for them yourself if there's not as many recruiting pushes from the companies, but I do think there should be plenty of postings online.

history.content:
hello!

I anticipate that I might graduate a semester early (that is, in Fall 2019) but I have some concerns about what I will be doing in Spring 2020. Somehow I have this notion in my head that companies won't be looking to hire as much as they would be towards the end of the school year and I will end up having a harder time finding a job then if I were to graduate in the Spring. Then again, I may be completely wrong and just over-stressing about things as I normally do, so if anyone has any insight into this or about any other drawbacks of Fall graduation in general please let me know! A lot of people graduate in the Fall though so I feel like I'm over-stressing....

thanks in advance! 

(and sorry if I made up some completely random thing about companies hiring less during certain times, but on a serious note my current situation does not allow for me having a couple of months of not being in school and not having a source of income)
history.subject: Potential drawbacks of Fall graduation?
